reviews.text: I would highly recommend this campsite, the pitches are level and well maintained and the site is crossed by several rows of trees that reduce the wind speed if it gets blustery. The toilet block is truly immaculate; the on-site shop appeared to be well stocked and the owners were very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Highly recommended.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The site was very quiet and relaxing and is an ideal base if you are visiting the nearby Bovington Tank Museum or Lulworth cove. There is a local chip shop, a Chinese take-away and a pub all within 5 minutes walking distance of the gate.
reviews.title: friendly campingsite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very good camping, nice helpfull people. Close to the railway though, but also near to the station. A very good place to explore the Jurrassic coast and visit Weymouth.
reviews.title: Perfect stay-cation!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found the campsite to be very clean, with excellent toilet facilities. The campsite offered free wifi, although very slow and a nightmare to connect to. The grass on the pitches is in pretty good condition and the pitches themselves are quite flat. Unfortunately when we stayed, the local pub was closed for refurb and the weather was a complete wash out, raining everyday so we ended our trip early but would definitely return to this campsite if i could guarantee the weather a little more.
reviews.title: Delightful friendly campsite

reviews.text: I chose Whitemead through a friend's recommendation. This is the third year i've been back, in 2011 visited 7 times over the season. It is a family run park and they are always very helpful,polite and approachable. The site is very well maintained with most pitches being on flat ground. The toilet block / showers are immaculately clean, there is always hot water available. The shop is handy for all things essential (one very good point about the shop is it has set opening hours) (i have been to another campsite previously and they opened and closed the shop when it suited so you never knew if you'd be lucky enough to find it open). There is a pool table in the games room, also available are free reading books (for when the English weather changes at a moments notice). There is ample leaflets on things to do,ie. cycle routes, kayaking, abbotsbury swannary. As for dogs being kept on a lead/under control, I do not think it is an unreasonable request, i think its commonsense in a public/communal area, some people (including my mum) are geniunely frightened of dogs. as for dog poo, dog owners would also not be best pleased if they or their children stepped in it and brought it into the tent/caravan/car. As a lone female traveller i feel very safe staying here as the owners live nearby the site. The site is very well located for Bournemouth, Poole, New Forest, Weymouth. You also have close by (walking distance if you are up for it) Monkey World, Bovington Tank Museum. The Village of Wool has a post office, spar, hairdressers, etc. which is a 10 min walk from site. 5min walk from site you have the railway station which takes you as far as London. There is also a bus stop at the railway station which takes you to Lyme Regis, Poole, West Bay, Weymouth.
reviews.title: Would Highly Recommend

reviews.text: A very unwelcoming badly run campsite. The owners seemed unable to cope with a large amount of visitors.
reviews.title: A lovely family friendly site...would highly recommend!!

reviews.text: No apparent drainage in the field and a very expensive poorly stocked shop.
reviews.title: Best Camp Site Yet

reviews.text: Watch out for the over officious gardener/binman. This guy beggars belief! It must be a power thing - he seems to delight in telling people off from the safe confines of his mini tractor.
reviews.title: Would never go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We wanted to spend a weekend at Lulworth and durdle door and the campsite near there was 3 times the price of this one so no chance. We had camped here a few years ago and found it very good.
reviews.title: Both good and bad - immaculate but bring ear plugs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked for one night but when we arrived we asked if we could possibly stay for 2, the staff were very accomodating and got us a pitch that had some flexibility.
reviews.title: Friendly site - Wonderful atmosphere!

reviews.text: The GOOD - Immaculate facilities, plenty of showers and toilets. :)
reviews.title: Planes, Trains & Automobiles

reviews.text: A nice little shop ( Ioved the comment from another reviewer who said it was good they sold wine as it is needed for the regular 'couple tent pitch fight' Ha ha )
reviews.title: best camp site

reviews.text: This was my first time at Whitemead Caravan Park as a solo motorhome user. I was on pitch 58 for 16 nights and felt at home there. The owners are really friendly and the shower/toilet block kept immaculate along with the laundry/dishwashing area. There are also pretty hanging baskets hanging outside the toilet/shower block and reception area.
reviews.title: I enjoyed my stay and felt safe and comfortable there
